about_the_game:
Devil’s Terminal is a cozy mystery visual novel about troubled teens, summer camp, and an occult AI. At Camp Guidance, you will take on the role of a socially anxious outcast and stumble upon an ancient computer that foretells a greater purpose for you. The story explores themes of being lost, late-night talks around a campfire, and the strange comfort of discovering who you really are.

Your new friends are weird—but in a cool way. They’re all battling inner demons, whether real or imagined, while figuring out what brought them to this point in their lives. They’re not all doom and gloom, though; they’re also funny, lovable, and kind when they want to be. You’ll want to make a good impression, because everyone wants teenagers to think they’re cool—even though no one ever really succeeds.

The game’s visuals were created by Murakami-san, whose work brings every character and scene to life. Each moment is designed to be emotional, weirdly significant, and entirely unforgettable—just like the real memories of summers past.

At its core, this is a game about free will, self-acceptance, and the ways we all choose to see the world. What’s real, and what’s just in our heads? Does the line even exist, and does it really matter? Can we make peace with ourselves? Can we forgive others? Can we ever truly see the world through someone else’s eyes? Devil’s Terminal won’t give you the answer, but it will try to lead you to your own.
